Each times the homework would consist of a few questions and it would be marked and the score would be counted on the course grade.

reviews.author: Shuwa
reviews.comment_content: the knowledge in this course is largely involved in DSE Economics syllabus. it's not a big issue if u get a good grade on dse econ!! Since all of the students who studied econ have been put into the same course and most of them are familiar with the syllabus, a lot of students could get high marks and the exam result curve is high. you have to put much effort on it or otherwise ,you would definitely left behind. so the most important thing about this course is to work hard and submit assignments punctually!

reviews.author: cheuk
reviews.title: EASY COURSE
reviews.comment_content:
basic topics in DSE with opportunity cost, demand and supply...
Also some new topics like game theory and indifference curve etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Participation is not required, I don't know much about her teaching. The tutorial notes and lecture notes are good.
Content of midterms will be covered in lecture while content of final will be covered in final. I recommend you to attend the tutorial at least.
reviews.comment_grading: 5% assignment and 95% for midterms and final.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. The quality of assignment is not counted for grading. 2 midterms and final. 40 MCs for each midterm, which is very easy if you attended the lecture.

reviews.author: VP
reviews.comment_content: The topics he taught are similar to economics in HKDSE, but a bit more advanced. In class, the questions seems easy. But the questions are much harder in mid-term this semester. No attendance is required in his class but he usually answers the important questions only in class so it's better to attend all the classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is not boring and he is funny. It is quite interesting because he would add his own experience as examples to teach the concepts in microeconomics.
reviews.comment_grading: Most of the people get B range I think, but I am not so good at economics I only get C range.
reviews.comment_workload: There are around 4 assignments. Woo Young asked us to do in groups of 1-5 people so the workload are not too heavy.

reviews.author: Anonymous user
reviews.comment_content: Largely based on the DSE curriculum with some new chapters including monopoly and game theory. Some calculations are involved.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching style is quite dull as she merely read the PowerPoints, and her explanation is not enlightening actually. Plus her uninviting voice, no wonder why a number of students physically or mentally skipped almost all lectures. Although PRS was used during lectures, attendance was not counted. In my opinion, skipping lectures will not hurt.
reviews.comment_grading: The two mid-terms are easy, consisting only of 45 MC questions. As a result, the mean was relatively high. However, the final exam is more challenging as there are MC questions, a great deal of calculations and some word problems (e.g. to explain the marginal utility theory). Fortunately, my grade turned out acceptable, attaining A-range.
reviews.comment_workload: Marks are awarded for the submission of problem sets, which can be blank.

reviews.author: Orangeee
reviews.comment_content:
Half of the syllabus is same as dse's one. Easy to catch up.

Ch0. Introduction
Ch1. Thinking like economists
Ch2. Specialization and Gain from Trade
Ch3. Demand and Supply
Ch4. Elasticity
Ch5. Efficiency and Equity
Ch6. Government meets Market
Ch8. Utility and Demand
Ch9. Possibilities, Preferences and Choices
Ch10. Organizing Production
Ch11. Output and Costs
Ch12. Perfect Competition
Ch13, Monopoly
Ch15. Strategic Interaction and Oligopoly
Ch17. Externalities
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite boring but she will go through all the details.
No attendance.

Recommend that you go to class everyday to ensure that you understand the concepts in the professor's ways so the exams will be much easier.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two MC midterms and a final - MC and open questions. The mean o midterms are high, nearly 90%. However the final is extremely hard and really tricky. Should study very hard for the finals as some problems you see will not something you learn before or it will ask you some basic concepts.

I get slightly higher than the mean in three tests and eventually get a B+. The grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload.
Need to submit 10 problem sets only. The problem set will not be marked hence by submission you will get marks already.

reviews.author: blalala
reviews.comment_content: Powerpoint is easy to follow and simple.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is funny and interactive. He let us watch video in class so the class would not be too boring.
reviews.comment_grading: He gives good grade. Even though you get poor result in mid term or final exam, you will still get a good grade ( of course not an A), but you can get a B or C range easily as long as you do the homework.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only a few homework and you can get in group to finish it. Each homework will only consist of a few queations which don't take you much time.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.comment_content: This a a economic course designed for students who have studied economics before in their high school.  Actually more than half of the content is covered in the HKDSE syllabus.  Therefore if you don't pay attention in class, do not do any revision, you should not fail.  But of course if you are aiming A range please work hard.  Professor Lim do not take attendance and you can swap freely between his classes, ie if you sleep late or due to other reasons you miss your class, you can still take the other one.  I quite appreciate this flexibility offered by Professor Lim.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lim's teaching content is acceptable.  Nothing special.  If you are interested in economics, you will understand more easily.  On the other hand, he also tell jokes in class.  This keeps the atmosphere not too boring.  He also tells stories about his family and himself.  Overall good teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Professor Lim is the only professor who tells me the exact grading curve in this semester.  Top 20% A range, the following 40% B range.  That means if you are just below mean, you still got a B-.  This is already a very "good" grade in ust.  Mid term 35%, final 45%, homework 20%.  So please do not "all in" final.  You will definitely regret if you do not study hard in mid term.  You don't have a chance to get an A if your mid term is bad.
reviews.comment_workload: No project, no reading, just have 4-5 homework sets in the whole semester.  Each homework set contains about 5 question.  Most importantly, you can form a group of 5 to do the homework.  One submission per group is required.  That means you actually just need to do 1 question per homework set.  In my point of view, this workload is light.

reviews.author: chlkaren
reviews.comment_content:
1   What is economics?
2   Specialization and Gain from trade
3   Demand and Supply
4   Elasticity
5   Efficiency and Equity
6   Government meets market
8   Utility and demand
9   Possibilities, Preferences and choices
10 Organizing Production
11 Output and costs
12 Perfect Competition
13 Monopoly
15 Strategic Interaction and oligopoly
17 Externalities

Generally speaking, what you learnt from secondary school only helps you with chapters 1-6 and 17. For chapters 8-15, you may feel confused during lectures as they are quite difficult to understand. More preparation and revision are needed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is kind and open-minded, just feel free to ask her questions after the lecture or send her email.
She provided examples to different concepts which can be found in her lecture notes. She also tried to make sure all pupils are able to understand what she was teaching. Yet, sometimes she rushed before the end of the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
As all the students had studied economics before, the mean was really high.
The first two mid-term exams were only MC questions but there were both MC and long questions in the final exam.
1st mid-term :
mean 86.7, median 87.5, s.d. 7.9
2nd mid-term :
mean 75.7, median 76.25, s.d. 11.94
Final :
mean 110.8/200, median 109.5/200, s.d. 29.95
If you below mean within 5 marks in both midterms, but above around 1 s.d. in final, you can get B+.
Just don't give up if you didn't do well in mid-terms, start revising earlier and you can still get good results eventually.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was really light, you only have to submit eight problem sets and the content won't be marked.
You should try to finish the problem sets, practice papers and tutorial worksheets if you want to obtain satisfactory grades.

reviews.author: Takeshikanshiro
reviews.comment_content: The course covers quite a lot of microeconomics topics. Most topics are very different from what we have learned in secondary school while some basic topics are quite similar. I have talked to Wooyoung and he found out that some concepts that we have learned are wrong in his opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wooyoung's teaching is interesting and he loves interacting with class. For example, he would invite students to participate in 'games' and wake up those who were asleep in his class.
Some examples he explained in class would appear in mid term or final exams,so , paying attention in and attending lectures are very important.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 homework ( 20%)
1 mid term exam ( 35% )
1 final exam ( 45% )

Homework usually involve 3-5 questions
Mid term and Final exam involves 3 long questions
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy in my opinion. As concepts in the lectures are quite difficult to understand, reading the textbook is mandatory.

reviews.author: lcyxd
reviews.comment_content:
Before first midterm: Content are covered in DSE syllabus
Second midterm and final: New topics that require high level of understanding and sole memorisation won't help.
Midterms consist MC only while final exam consists both MC and structured questions. Final is much harder than midterms and mostly covered new topics although it is cumulative.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor provided more detailed explanation in class but classes were generally boring. Tutorials are more useful than lectures as most important concepts and question types that usually appear in exams were being highlighted
reviews.comment_grading:
First midterm: Above 1 SD
Second midterm: Max
Final exam: Above 1.5 SD
Final grading: A
reviews.comment_workload: Not high - as long as you can hand in problem sets on time and you'll be dine.

reviews.author: kakahahaha
reviews.title: 好好grade
reviews.comment_content:
Microeconomics
睇notes ， 唔明就睇書， 再唔明睇youtube, 再唔明問TA.
上lectures 就算啦 哈哈
reviews.comment_teaching:
if u find that the lecturer cant help u understand the concepts, DON'T attendant lesson!DON'T attendant lesson!DON'T attendant lesson! Read books and notes and youtube maybe more helpful.
BTW, the TA's English is funny but he is hardworking and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got overall weighted 87.5% and got A.
but seems many ppl got A. (82.x% still can get A)
So I think the course is very good grade.
mid-term 好易，all MCs, 求其就得， 個mean好高分.
Final 係決戰！！！
Final 記住溫圖！！！(PPF, inference curve, game theory table, monopoly curve etc)
reviews.comment_workload:
super light, no class attendance is needed,
assignments 只計你有冇handin, 唔理content, 所以交空doc.都得。

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.comment_content:
Quite interesting,
50% of the content is similar to DSE econ syllabus so better not skip the latter lectures. It is quite boring in the first few lectures. In the latter lectures, many new concepts are not as easy as those earlier to understand.
I like the game theory part.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She tries hard to make the lecture interactive. You can tell this as she asks a lot of questions but sometimes i feel sorry for prof coz none answers her questions.

You can skip the lectures and tutorials since attendance is not required.
reviews.comment_grading:
Problem set: 60/80
Midterm 1: 95/100
Midterm 2: 90/100
Final: 143.5/200
The mean is 110.8, median is 109.5, SD is 29.95

Weighted overall : 82.x% (forgot)

Grade: A

The final is quite hard, especially the long question part since you dk what the professors expect you to answer. But i think as long as you read the PPT slides thoroughly and did some problem sets also try to draw the graphs required then it would be fine for your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. You can submit a blank word doc as assignment and skip all the lectures if you can learn it by yourself.

reviews.author: cwyyy
reviews.comment_content: Some basic economic concepts are included at the beginning of the course, should be something you have learned in secondary school. (Production possibilities frontier, demand and supply, elasticity etc.) Some new concepts such as indifference curves are also taught. MANY graphs for topics like monopolistic competition and monopoly. I think parts on Game Theory and Indifference Curve may take you some time to understand. The content is quite OK.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Lim is passionate and funny. He tries to arouse students' interest with his dynamic style of teaching. Sometimes, Professor Lim also includes his personal experience in his lecture for illustration. His lesson is pretty vivid. However, I sometimes found his explanation during class pretty confusing.
Yet, if he finds you not paying attention but just phubbing (playing with your phone), he may ask you questions. Just be concentrate during lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is proportional to how much effort you have put into this course.
Got >/= 90% for all the 3 assignments.
The mean of the mid-term was just around 106/200 and I screwed it up 'cause I did not put enough effort in it (below mean). The final (cumulative) mean was 115/200 and I worked hard and got above mean 1 SD. Final grade: B+
Need not to take attendance for Professor Lim's lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Assignments in total. Group yourselves into 5 at most. Around 5 to 6 questions from the problem set previously sent by Professor Lim for each assignment. Some questions can be challenging.
Professor sometimes covers one or two questions from the assignment during lessons, so better no to skip lessons. You can always approach the TA if you have any questions concerning the assignment.

reviews.author: ducky
reviews.comment_content: Half (or even more) of the content is DSE curriculum, so it would not be too difficult for students who have studied economics before. However, there are few topics that are new and difficult to understand (e.g game theory, common resource, indifference curve)
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is bad. Although he is passionate, he does not explain content clearly. Things that are in fact simple, he teaches them in a difficult way. Also, he likes teaching difficult parts in every chapter. Lecture notes will be uploaded to canvas. However, those lecture notes are from the publisher. The materials are messy and not well-organized. Many things that he mentions in the lecture (covered in exams) are not written down in notes. Students who aim high, need to jot notes in his lecture and it takes much time to re-organize what he said in the lecture. But he replies email from students quickly and willing to answer questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% midterm
45% final
20% Homework
No participation mark. The grading is ok. The marginal grade for students who below mean within 1 sd is D-. However, the midterm is very difficult. No MC in all his exam. All questions are long questions and each of them carries very high mark (one question carries 80-100 marks). Due to the difficulty in both midterm and final, the mean is not high ( around 50%). But the grading is on curve.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not high. There is only 3 homework required. Homework is also long questions (questions in past exam). It is group work, so each one does 1-2 questions will be fine.
But students who aim A/B range really need to study hard for midterm and final, don't expect to get high mark without attending his lecture and doing all homework questions before exams for more times.

reviews.author: jdub___
reviews.comment_content: Microeconomics topics including demand and supply, allocative efficiency, output-cost relationships in the short run and long run, monopoly and its pricing strategies, mapping consumer preferences using indifference curves etc. All the content is more mathematically-oriented than that I've learnt in high school (I've studied the DSE curriculum), with some topics requiring a certain level of understanding about basic differentiation principles. So it takes some time to adjust one's mindset, even if they've studied economics before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lim is quite a nice professor: he encourages us to ask questions whenever we have them, and he always tries to explain the concepts to us as clearly as possible. He will also interact with students, encouraging students to participate in in-class activities. Sometimes he will talk about his personal experiences and personal life just to make the lecture more interesting and to make his explanations about concepts more vivid.
reviews.comment_grading: As all of the students had studied economics in high school, the means for homework, mid-term and final were quite high. So that means you would have to do really well to get a good grade. The homework has to be done in a group, so what score you get really depends on your group mates.
reviews.comment_workload: We had to do homework for 4 times during the semester. Other than that, there's nothing extra to do.

reviews.author: Candy. C
reviews.comment_content: Nearly cover the whole DSE syllabus, while also teach something extra. As the schedule is quite tight, it will be quite hard to catch up if you miss any class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lim is a funny instructor and his lecture is quite interesting.  The lectures are easy to follow, while the tutorial before homework deadlines and test are very useful. The TA explain the material in a very detail manner and you can seek help from him whenever you face any difficulty as he is a very nice person.
reviews.comment_grading: Once you attend every classes and revise PPT before test, it is not hard to get A grade in mid-term.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 group homework in a semester is reasonable.

reviews.author: Striver
reviews.title: Be wise when choosing professor
reviews.comment_content:
About microeconomics.
But different professor does not teach exactly the same scope. Professor Lim is majoring in particularly Game Theory, so he always mentions it in lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be frank, the teaching is bad.
I did not skip any of the lecture lessons from Professor Lim. On the first lesson, I thought I was so lucky that I had quite a fun person to be my professor, especially when I knew that he is a Korean. However, his explanation is not good. Maybe this is my problem. Believe it or not, he explained every topic for a long time but I personally do not think he elaborate them in a clear way.

Also, I do not think he is a person with passion in teaching and helping you. He provided his own-created practice questions for you as homework. However, he will only post the answer to canvas a week or so before the exam. Moreover, his answers which are created by him again are so simple that it could be fewer than ten words for a question with more than 30 marks. It made me so confusing and could not catch up with what he really wanted us to answer. When my friends and I tried to ask him for more detailed answer key, he just answered that he saw no point in doing it and eventually ignored our request.

Sorry for those who love Professor Lim a not, but  I really do not have much good impression about him. I hope all of you could be wise in choose your professor!
reviews.comment_grading:
Like what I said about his teaching, it is extremely hard to get high marks in his exams in which all long questions are designed by him again...

Believe me, you wont be able to compete with other students who could get the past paper and detailed answer explanation. Just choose another professor.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload. Just hand in homework questions for a few times. And it is done in groups.

No attendance. No project.

reviews.author: edwinnkk
reviews.comment_content: Demand Supply, Elasticity, Market structure etc...all basic econ stuff you can imagine. There are iPRS questions every lecture to test students' understanding but are not recorded for your attendance.  If you think you're good enough for this course, you can skip every lessons, and tutorial for sure.
reviews.comment_teaching: She's actually very open to questions and discussions and always tries to explain everything in depth.
reviews.comment_grading: Normal grading, not especially good or bad as compared to other ust courses I have taken.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. She doesn't give a . what you uploaded on canvas. Just upload on time then you got all the homeworkmarks.

reviews.author: Jessie Ho
reviews.comment_content: In-deph content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not very hard to catch up with, for most of the topics.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not very harsh.
reviews.comment_workload: The course workload is not difficult to handle. There were a few sets of homework exercises that are assigned by the professor, she, however stated very clearly that the assignment is graded merely on the record of handing it in but not your answer. In this sense, part of your mark for the course grade is in fact secured, and that you are allowed to finish the assignment under a schedule that you see fit.

reviews.author: _ry
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter1-What is Economics
Chapter2-The Economic Problem
Chapter3-Supply and Demand
Chapter4-Elasticity
Chapter5-Efficiency and Equity
Chapter6-Government Actions in Markets
Chapter7-Global Markets in Actions
Chapter8,9-Possibilities, Preferences, and Choices
Chapter11-Output and Costs
Chapter12-Perfect Competition
Chapter13-Monopoly
Chapter15-Oligopoly
Chapter16-Public Goods

Personally, I think it was not only about DSE econ, content was more deep and in detail. New concepts and content were also introduced in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She taught quite well, explanation was adequate and clear
Pace was just right, not too fast and not too slow.
2 Worksheets were given before midterm and final respectively, there were some short questions. Some of them might be similar to short questions in exams.
Tutorials were quite useful, although it was not compulsory, additional worksheets were distributed.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was a bit harsh
Mean for exams were quite high

Scheme1:
Problem sets: 10%
Qizzes: 10%
Midterm1+2: 20%+20%
Final: 40%

Scheme2:
Problem sets: 10%
Quizzes: 10%
Midterm1 OR 2(the higher one): 30%
Final: 50%

Attended 2 midterm, above mean for about 1SD
Got 96/100 in Final
and the grade was A-
reviews.comment_workload:
10 quizzes on canvas (weekly basis)
2 problem sets to be handed in in hard copies

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.comment_content: If you study HKDSE / IB Econ courses in high school, this course is a piece of cake, as it covers more or less the same thing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She uses iPRS, fyi.

Basically she just reads from the power point.  Even if she tried to be interactive and asks us questions, we are not slightly motivated...
reviews.comment_grading: I will say the grading is fair.  For a person like me who did not study much, Professor Ding had given me a B, which I was really happy about.  With more studying, A range is achievable for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Professor Ding said she had given out assignments as her only course workload, but no one really know if she would mark the assignments (handed in online).  Some of my friends taking this course had missed her assignments and still got good grades.

reviews.author: marcoreus
reviews.comment_content: Half of it is covered in secondary and the new things are not difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit boring but she explains quite clearly
reviews.comment_grading:
two mid terms
final
homework

the mid terms are all mc and very easy
final is more difficult but not very
homework only check your submission
reviews.comment_workload: quite few as only have some online homework and she wont see the content of your work.in fact you can only submit a blank page to her every time and she will still give you full mark of homework.

reviews.author: Eilot
reviews.comment_content: It may be a little bit boring for those who have taken Economics in local secondary school . But ,most of the topic is quite related to HKDSE Economies .
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very nice . She will give candy or money to those people who answer her question .She will also share her daily life . 10 minutes break is given at each lesson
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good . Mid term quiz and final examination is not difficult . The question type is usually multiple choices and short question
reviews.comment_workload: Not much . Just 10 online quiz and two question set . This session does not record attendence .

reviews.author: Kmiu
reviews.comment_content:
Opportunities cost
PPF
monopoly
oligopoly
monopolistic competition
production curve..
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pointpower
Some video
It is easy for you to catch up the lesson by reading the powerpoint and books at home
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two schemes for grading.
The one with higher score will be counted.

Scheme 1: Course score with two midterms
problem sets            10%
quizzes                     10%
midterms (1) and (2) 20%+20%
final                          40%

Scheme 2: Course score with one midterms
problem sets             10%
quizzes                      10%
midterms (1) and (2)  30%
final                            50%

It is so hard to get A range..
reviews.comment_workload:
workloads were normal, or even relaxing.
You dont even have to do a lot of exercise and practices

reviews.author: purple
reviews.comment_content:
Opportunities cost
PPF
monopoly
oligopoly
monopolistic competition
production curve
etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
She basically read out the powerpoint.
Sometimes she further explained some relative complicated economic concepts in her own words.
It was easy to catch up the lesson because the pace of the lesson is relatively slow.
During the lesson, there were PRS to test the knowledge just taught or have a revision before midterm and exam. Those won't be counted to grading.
Also, there were a few games to introduce some knowledge like the different pricing strategies between monopoly, oligopoly and monopolistic competition.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two schemes for grading.
The one with higher score will be counted.

Scheme 1: Course score with two midterms
problem sets            10%
quizzes                     10%
midterms (1) and (2) 20%+20%
final                          40%

Scheme 2: Course score with one midterms
problem sets             10%
quizzes                      10%
midterms (1) and (2)  30%
final                            50%

Additionally, students can get extra credits by answering her questions (not every questions could have extra credits unless she specified) and being volunteers to do easy experiments (like eating cookies)

problem set 1: 100/100 mean: 91.6
problem set 2: 100/100 mean: 90.3

midterm 1: 92/100 mean: 85.9
midterm 2: 86.5/100 mean: 81.1

final exam: 78/100 mean: 85
final grading: b-

The content of midterms and final were easy. I got quite bad result from the final was due to my carelessness.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Ten quizzes in canvas
(as long as you finish them, you can get all marks from quizzes part no matter how many marks you get from the quizzes)
(There are 10 questions in each quizzes)
2. Two problem sets (which the questions from the textbook)
3. Two midterms
4. One accumulative final

the workloads were normal

reviews.author: ac6
reviews.title: Simple Economics
reviews.comment_content: Content is related to DSE/CE/AL Economics. Basic Stuff. Half of the syllabus is from secondary school. Content is kinda interesting and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not super interesting. There are some interactions and games during some lectures tho. The teaching assistants did provided lots of useful skills and exercises.
reviews.comment_grading: The Grading is quite nice. Midterms and Finals and quite easy. Only need to avoid mistakes then you could have good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Complete homework sets which are a bit complicated. Overall the workload is low. We were also given quite a lot of time to prepare.

reviews.author: a.stupid
reviews.title: Boring basic economics
reviews.comment_content: It's basically the extension of HKDSE economics. Content includes utility concept, and consumption possibilities, and also a review of what you have learned in secondary school. I would say it is not that hard if you pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wenwen try to be fun and motivate us to speak out in class. However, the teaching is a bit boring, i confess. She is a nice lecturer indeed, and would answer your questions after class. And she remembers your name too. one point to add: she will give extra marks for student who answered her credit-bearing questions.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a B from her, which i merely accepted. Wenwee gave grade fairly, but it's just not as good as other lecturers, such as ding fei.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a bit too much for me, as there is two take-home assignments and ten quiz to submit on canvas. And also two midterms and one final. My friends took ding fei's course and they told me that ding fei's midterm is MCs and a few short questions quile wenwen's midterm is much more harder.

reviews.author: kaykaylav
reviews.comment_content: Quite basic concepts involved and doesn't really take attendance, even though there's iPRS.
reviews.comment_teaching: Don't understand a thing at all, the notes are useless because there is no explanations or examples of the most difficult topics which consisted half of the mid term and finals.
reviews.comment_grading: Nothing special, if you are above mean by a SD for mid term but at mean for finals, you'll get a B
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all, only some weekly assignments but accuracy doesn't count. As long as you don't send a blank page for assignment and no late submissions, it'll be perfectly fine.

reviews.author: YY520
reviews.comment_content: The course discusses concepts in DSE Economics most. If you think DSE Economics is not really difficult, then you need not worry about this course. This course also includes some new Economics concepts, which i think is not very challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor taught quite well. She sometimes raised questions and gave presents to those who answered the questions. Also, we use IPRS during the lesson to do some practice. I think the class is quite funny.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is either not good or not bad.  If your final result is above mean, it is likely for you to get at least a B.
reviews.comment_workload: We had 2 mid-term exams and final exam. Also, we had some quizzes and problem set. I think taking this course is not demanding.

reviews.author: 36467912abcd
reviews.comment_content: The content is quie gd. She bases her analysis on lots of real life examples. They provide you a great insight when analyzising some social issues,like minimum wage in Hong Kong
reviews.comment_teaching: Frankly speaking, its quite boring and she will rush in the end if she can't finish all chapter planned. But she will go through every details with you,so if you are concentrated enough, you can get a fluent flow of the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
MY grade A+
Mid term 1:95/100         mean~88      SD~10
Mid term 2:97.5/100      mean76.3     SD11.2
Final Exam:90.75/100   mean61.97   SD13.83
reviews.comment_workload: 1 HW for every chapter,but as long as you submit it through canvas(independent of the quality), you will earn that hw mark

reviews.author: Clara Ng
reviews.comment_content: Most of them are included in the DSE syllabus, but it contain both elective parts in DSE. Fortunately, it is quite easy to follow even you just attend the tutorial.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wenwen's teaching is good, she shows video clip to the class sometimes to make the class more interesting and enhance our understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is taken from the highest score calculated by  two grading system, one weight more on the final and the other less. So you can still get a high grade if you don't get a high score in final.
reviews.comment_workload: Two midterm, one final with MCs and few long question. There are few assignments, but quite easy. Also, no attendance taken, so the workload is light I would say.

reviews.author: kkcone
reviews.comment_content: Based on DSE syllabus and some more in depth contents. As this course is for those who have Econ background, so it won't be difficult to understand the materials.
reviews.comment_teaching: I have attended both Ding, Fei and Wenwen's lessons, I would say the way that Wenwen taught was more like when we were in secondary school which some may think it's better while some don't. As fro Ding, Fei, she taught a bit slower than Wenwen, because she may focus on discussing one single question for half of the lesson.I believe the purpose was that she wanted us to think and discuss and "explore" the answers by ourselves. I think both of them are quite good.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say I didn't do well in DSE economics, but I was enrolled to this course to compete with the top students with stronger economic sense, so I was trying so hard to catch up with the average. I thought I would I did poorly, but it turns out to be a fair grade. Ding Fei would have PRS in her lessons, but I am not sure if she would consider that as attendance check.
reviews.comment_workload: There are some book exercises to complete and hand them in through canvas. Both the mid terms are MCs. While the final consists both short questions and mcs, Overall I think the workload is light.

reviews.author: lamny
reviews.title: econ 2113
reviews.comment_content:
mostly about dse econ stuff
detailed ppt with slides around 50 or above
are willing to stay behind and explain
reviews.comment_teaching:
mainly talk about ppt, some extra exercise will be given in class and canvas
sometimes there are interactive role play session in lectures
have PRS but do not count attendance
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading
full mark for the homework part
midterms are below mean for 2 times
final are below mean as well
at last got B
reviews.comment_workload:
only 2 problem sets and other weekly quiz
2 mid terms(MC with short question)
Final (ms with short question)
no attendance

reviews.author: yhngao
reviews.comment_content:
1/3 topics are covered in dse economics
the other 2/3 are quite difficult (at least for me)

detailed powerpoint, normally 50 slides or above
reviews.comment_teaching:
so far i did attend lectures for only few times because i think attending lectures don't help me a lot. i think using the lecture time to do self study and revision would be a wiser choice. lectures are boring and a lot of students skipped econ lectures, so i do not have much to comment

for ta peter, i think tutorial is a bit useful than lecture that tutorials cleared some of my wrong concepts
reviews.comment_grading:
i got mean for mid term one and below mean for mid term 2 and finals, but i still got a satisfactory grade

i think the grading is fair and better than the other class (prof zhang wen wen)
reviews.comment_workload:
8-10 problem sets with questions from different chapters. you get full marks as long as you have submitted them on canvas. you could easily finish them if you have sources from others.

2 mid terms (full MC)

final: MC plus long questions (quite demanding)

not much to do and no attendance taking

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.title: A Class That You Can Skip a Lot :))))
reviews.comment_content:
simple economic concepts
basically a quick revision course of high school materials
light, not hard to comprehend
reviews.comment_teaching:
you can afford to skip her classes because she just reads off the ppt slides, and her slides are pretty complete and self-explanatory + no attendance

personally not a fan of her voice, it gets annoying after a while. but she's a nice teacher who is willing to answer your questions in breaks and after class
reviews.comment_grading:
a very competitive course, everyone is super smart and her exams are not difficult
expect to have means around 80-85
and mode around 90-95
if you get below 75 in exams, you're considered stupid!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
no homework, just have your own conscience to revise and read up on your own to catch up in understanding and grasping the content to the best of your ability

she gives out 10 canvas quizzes (doesn't count towards final grades, as long as you complete them all!) + ungraded iPRS questions in class

reviews.author: Ivan wai
reviews.comment_content: More in-depth content when compared with HKDSE syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
會寫好多野喺notes到，上堂嘅話會聽多D notes印好以外嘅野，不過唔上堂問人拎翻notes嚟抄都可以
有時上堂會播下片同埋講下笑, 氣氛幾好
reviews.comment_grading:
算好Grade, above到SD少少都可以有B range
Mid term同final個mean大概係70幾至80幾
reviews.comment_workload: 少workload, 成個semster只需交兩份problem set同埋做10份online quiz(每份quiz 10題MC)

reviews.author: Hebi
reviews.comment_content:
-basic microeconomic knowledge.
-quite easy with a great proportion of content covered in dse syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-she just keeps talking throughout the lesson.
-it's actually okay not to go for her lessons given that you revise and read the ppt and understand everything yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
-good grade!
-2 mid terms with only mc
-finals with harder questions compared with mid terms. (both mc and long questions are included)
-quite high mean and median in mid terms but low mean in finals.
reviews.comment_workload:
-not much workload.
-assignments: problem sets but only submission is counted regardless of the content.

reviews.author: Leonardo
reviews.comment_content: One-third to half of the topics in the course is covered in NSS Economics and the other topics come from AL Economics(I believe lol), so all in all it is not very hard to study and follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Though as I mentioned the course material is not particularly hard so her teaching doesn't affect much, I would say her teaching is pretty clear with an appropriate pace. I would also like to give credit to her effort in trying to make the lectures more interactive by incorporating 'experiments' in some lessons which require participation
reviews.comment_grading: Actually I'm not sure about the grading scheme. But from my personal feeling, I would say it is not particularly easy to obtain an A-range grade, but due to the pretty easy content, with minimal effort a B-range grade would not be hard for most.
reviews.comment_workload: PRS question is the only in-class work. Very little after-class work as well with only a 10-question quiz every week and two problem sets in total. Overall, this is among the lightest workload of my courses in the first semester in UST.

reviews.author: IpNing
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite interesting and easy for those who have studied economics in dse. More than half of the content are the same with that in dse and there are also new knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite clear and there are some interacting activities during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Becasue this course is for students who have studied economics in dse so there is keen competition, it is hard to get good grade.
get more than 90 in mid-term and fianl, at last A
reviews.comment_workload:
2 problem sets and a online quiz every week but the online quiz is not credit by submission.
2 mid-term and 1 final

reviews.author: TC
reviews.title: You need to be careful in order to get good grade
reviews.comment_content: The first half of the course should be simple for most of the students, as they are only about DSE econ stuff. So basically you can skip all lessons before first mid-term exam. However, you need to pay attention into some new concepts that are not included in the DSE econ. For example, budget line, indifference curve etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is nothing special at all. I mean, if you are willing to pay effort to read the notes yourself, you need not attend her lessons. During lecture, she just add some extra stuff/ explanations which are not going to be covered in the mid-term/final.
reviews.comment_grading:
Personally I think the grading system of this course is quite tough. Take myself as an example. I have 86% in 1st mid-term (median for 1st mid-term); 91% in 2nd mid-term (above mean for around 1 sd); 95.5% in the final exam (above mean for more than 1 sd); completed all quizzes; 1 problem set got full mark , another one got 90% (because of careless)
My overall score for this course is 94.55%, but I can only receive an A- in this course. So if you really want to get a good grade, remember avoid careless mistakes and complete all items as good as possible!
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light compared with other courses.
Only a few items:
1. 10 online quizzes (credited by hand-in)
2. two problem sets (5% each)
3. two mid-term tests (2 grading system, 40% for counting both: one is counting both mid-term; 30% for counting one: another one is counting one mid-term only) she will choose the one which can generate higher score for you, so you should attend both mid-term tests
4. Final exam (weighted 40/50%, depends on which mid-term calculation approach you have adopted)

reviews.author: Law~
reviews.title: Thanks Wenwen!
reviews.comment_content:
Very fundamental Economics. The course starts from NSS Economics (which all local ECON2113 students should have good grasps on it), and then develops into Utility & Demand, Cost and Output, Market Types (perfect competition, monopoly, oligopoly)

The first 40% of course is very easy to everyone. However, difficulties will escalate afterwards and regular practices on questions are very important (The part on utility, indifference curve analysis is the most difficult part because it was an untaught topic in HKDSE but appeared in HKALE)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her teaching is quite boring because she just reads  the Powerpoint slides and add some notes on it. Although it is boring, your concepts will be very clear if you can tolerate that boredom and strive through the semester.

She will assess some side-concepts (but difficult) mentioned in class. For mid-term 2, she assessed the concept that was taught for a few minutes in class (Indifference curve analysis involving Inferior goods). Attend her lessons if you can.
reviews.comment_grading:
I get an A in this course. Thanks Wenwen!

The examinations are so simple, very simple that even HKCEE Examination is more difficult (even the same for final examination). Careless mistakes are too FATAL that can kill your grade. I don't support this way of assessment because it fails to categorise able, hard-working students and lazy students effectively. The paper should be set more difficult.

I get 95% finally (95.7% also A). I have heard that cut-off for A+ is 96%. From UST FYS Secret, I hear that some students get B-range for >90% (not completely assured).

During the class, she would invite students to come out and perform activities that facilitate her teaching. This will add 2 credits to your final examination. It is VERY VERY VERY important that it can boost your sub-grade by 1 level. I strongly recommend those who enrol to her course do at least 1 along the semester!
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light.

You don't need to attend the tutorial. I attended two and three and skipped the remaining.

There are 2 problem sets in the whole semester - Remember to finish them properly with 100% effort. The reason why I cannot get A+ is because i didn't finish the problem set very seriously.

reviews.author: Chunjaiii
reviews.title: ECON 2113
reviews.comment_content: The contents of her powerpoints are great with a lot of details, you can easily understand what the theories are talking about. You can also get a high marks through reading her powerpoints. There are 14 microeconomics topic in the whole semester. Most of them are the topics which taught in the DSE syllabus including externalities, short run long run, efficiency and equity, etc. It is easy to handle them if you have studied economics in your DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is nice and she always explains the   economics theories through games and activities. Also, there are no attendance system for her classes. Therefore, you can either attend her classes or absent from her classes, no punishment will be given. However, In my semester, there are 2 points for people who have answer her questions in the lecture.Tutorials are also available. There are useful notes provided in the tutorial classes, which is more important than attending the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: You can easily get a high marks in the exam if you have written relevant concepts in the paper. However, The curve is very high. A range is about 90 something%. You may able to get a A by earning nearly full marks of the mid-term exam and final exam. For the mid term exams, you may either attend both mid terms exams or just attend one exams. There are two grading systems: 1. 20% each for the two mid term exams and 40% for the final exam; 2. 30% for one of the mid term exams and 50% for the final exam. The teacher assistant will help you to use one of the methods to calculate your final scores. So you no need to worry whether you should attend one of the mid terms or atend both mid term exams.
reviews.comment_workload: The wokrload is not very high. There are 10 online quizzes with 10 mc questions each and 2 problem set questions within 20 questions each in the semesters. As for the quizzes, participation marks will be given no matter what your scores are. For the problem set questions, most of them can be either found in the textbooks or in the websites. Therefore, you may find many sources and you no need to do by yourself.

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content: ECON 2113 is an economics course for students with some econ. background. Part of the content was already covered in HKDSE syllabus, such as opportunity cost, demand/supply, elasticity, government intervention and production possibilities - these were mostly covered before the first mid-term. After the first mid-term the difficulty of the content has increased a lot - indifference curves, long-run/short-run production, oligopoly games, etc. We might have some basic ideas on these topics in HKDSE but they would be discussed in a more in-depth manner in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I cannot say Prof. Ding's teaching is useless - she does help me to clear some misunderstandings on the concepts. But her speaking tone is pretty boring and flat, making me fall asleep very often... anyway attendance is not compulsory, just skip the lectures if you can understand the content and dislike her voice.
TA is Peter. He usually covers useful mathematical approaches for solving problems in tutorials, which the problems will appear in the exams. I think it is good for you to attend the tutorials, or at least take a hard-copy of the tutorial notes.
Both Prof. Ding and Peter welcome questions. They are quite patient to answer you. Don't hesitate to ask if you have some difficulties.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Problem Sets - 5%
2 Mid-terms - 25% each
Final Exam - 45%

You can skip up to 1 mid-term and your grading scheme will automatically become:
Problem Sets - 5%
Mid-term - 35%
Final Exam - 60%

Some statistics for the exams:
Mid-term 1
Mean: 87.52  SD: 8.03
Mid-term 2
Mean: 76.32  SD: 11.16
Final exam
Mean: 61.97  SD: 13.82

Got 95, 87.5 and 68 in the three exams respectively (+1 SD, +1 SD and +0.5 SD) and handed in all problem sets, overall score 83.5% and I got a B+. But one of my friends got just 1% below my overall score and got a B. I definitely won't say the grading is generous, but at least, acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload: You will have to do a problem set after covering 2 chapters. Totally 8 problem sets in the semester. The problem set basically comes from the exercises in the textbook. However, as long as you have submitted a word file on time - no matter what the content is, you would get full credits. You can just submit a file without a single word if you do not have time to do the assignments, but of course it's to your advantage to complete the problem sets.

reviews.author: Reguna
reviews.title: GOD GRADE
reviews.comment_content:
Very Easy
DSE Level Economics with utility theory and some game theory
If you know Cantonese, Herman Yeung can help you if you have any problem
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her teaching was okay
if you dont understand wt she is saying,
go home and self-study
it is not that hard anyway
reviews.comment_grading:
GOD GRADE
Midterm 1 above mean 1 sd
midterm 2 & final above mean
And I got an A
THANK YOU DING FEI
reviews.comment_workload:
ZERO WORKLOAD
THEY WONT CHECK YOUR HOMEWORK
I SUBMITTED THE SAME FILE FOR ALL ASSIGNMENTS
but there are two midterms

reviews.author: Tiana
reviews.title: Do work hard to get a decent grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is not very difficult. Basically many topics are covered in DSE so it is quite relaxing and easy to follow at the beginning. Some topics like consumption possibilities,perfect competition and monopoly are quite difficult and very different from DSE so it is better to pay more attention to these chapters.If you can't follow, you may find the professor or TA immediately , they are willing to help. It 's better not to accumulate or leave your questions as you can't learn everything before exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: The explanation in lecture is very clear and adequate. But sometimes it is quite a rush in the lectures and it is difficult to follow, especially in some topics that are not taught in DSE. She will write some notes on the printed powerpoint slides so personally it is better to print out a copy of powerpoint and follow what she writes. Jotting notes in computer may be less efficient. Before midterms and final exam, she will give us some in-class exercise and MC questions which are generally easy and help us prepare for exam. Sometimes at the beginning of lectures she will share some videos which are quite funny. The TA guy will give us some exercises in tutorials but he is rushing everything super fast !!! If you have not attended lectures, basically you can't follow in tutorials after midterm 1.
reviews.comment_grading: The content is not difficult in this course so if you want to get a good grade, you may have to work hard and understand all the concepts thoroughly. There are two midterms and one final which are not difficult and the mean is quite high, like 8x% in the first midterm. The exam questions are very different from DSE one and at first it seems difficult as you are not familiar with the question type. However basically if you understand all the concepts thoroughly, attend all the lectures and tutorials and do the self-practices and problem sets, you will be doing fine in exam. Good grade comes with hard work. You can also earn some extra credits if you answer questions in lecture.
reviews.comment_workload: Two problems sets have to be submitted during semester and  it will be graded. It is easy to get high mark. If you find the  questions difficult, searching online may help you. Throughout the course, 10 quizzes have to be finished and credits are earned through submission.

reviews.author: Tommy=]
reviews.comment_content:
2113係開俾DSE有讀過econ既同學仔,所以好多野大家都會有基礎,要高分就要俾d心機
mid term 1前教既野都係DSE學過,不外乎OC,PPF, D&S同elasticity,真係好簡單
但mid term 2既野會複雜d,會教下indifference curve, MRS, marginal utility呢d concept
Final既話會考埋LR-SR production, economies of scale, competitive market, oligopoly, monopoly,真係要落足心機準備final!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
ding fei講事真係好悶....我成日上堂都訓著左
可能個陣係我sports skill class之後先上,所以運動完就想訓掛...
佢本身個人講野真係好悶,份人好嚴肅,但睇得出有heart教,可能係佢講野語調長期得一個pitch,所以我先會覺得好悶
reviews.comment_grading:
2個mid term同final, 第一個mid term cover既野dse都有教,其實唔難,只係多左income elasticity, cross elasticity呢d野,如果齋學完dse都岩唔到30條既話,我建議你去驗腦
第二個mid term其實都唔難
至於final就...真係好難...唔似mid term咁有mc俾你撞, sq同lq真係要有睇書同上堂先會識,果次個mean都唔高,大約70左右
Grade唔差,其實econ呢科真係考用腦多過計數,所以成個course既數真係手計都識,主要考你分析
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment唔算多,大約成個sem夾埋有10個problem set左右
不過ding fei講到明唔會睇功課內容,有交就俾分,所以好多人就...(你懂的)

reviews.author: Crying in UST
reviews.comment_content:
This course is for the students who studied economics before so most of the content are similar with DSE.
PRS will be used in lectures and there are some MCQs will be asked and students are required to respond in real time.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Zhang is really nice, she always answer the questions asked by students with a smile. She specks with a high tone and that's why students will not fall asleep easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall score for the course will be computed according to one of the two schemes, whichever yields the higher score.
1)
Problem Sets 10%
Quizzes 10%
Midterm Exam (1) and (2)  20%+20%
Final exam 40%
2)
Problem Sets 10%
Quizzes 10%
Midterm Exam (1) or (2), the higher one 30%
Final exam (cumulative)  50%

The mean of two midterm exams: 85.9 and81.1
reviews.comment_workload: There are 10 quizzes and 2 problem sets during the semester.  Quizzes are MCQs and submitted on the canvas. There is no time limit for the quizzes. Actually, quizzes are credited by submissions so many students will not finish them seriously.

reviews.author: Aakash
reviews.title: Content too easy, teaching bland
reviews.comment_content: Most of the syllabus content has already been covered in the IB/DSE, making the lectures very boring, and the tutorials useless. Furthermore, there is an alarming lack of use of higher-order skills in this course. By higher-order skills, I mean evaluation, synthesis, etc. This, again, has the effect of removing any potential challenge (if there was any to be had) from this course. Therefore, I think this course has no actual use, apart from helping students fulfill their requirements.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There is literally no interaction between the lecturer and the students. When the lecturer literally has to bribe the students to answer questions, it is obvious that the lecturer lacks ability to interact with students.

With regards to actual content, the lecturer is content with just reading from the powerpoint files that are on canvas. The only saving grace is that the lecturer explains how to do problems quite well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall, the grading system is excellent. This is because there are 2 marking schemes and the one with the higher mark is chosen. The difference between these 2 schemes is the different weights allocated to the midterm exams. Therefore, if you screw up one midterm, fear not.

As for the quizzes, students have an entire week to do one quiz, and there is no time limit for the quizzes. Students can also access any notes/lecture materials when doing the quiz, and so there is no actual difficulty. Quizzes are an excellent place to pick up marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is nonexistent. There is no actual homework/assignments to do, apart from quizzes and problem sets. For more information regarding the quizzes, look at the 'Grading' section of this review.

reviews.author: hibye01
reviews.comment_content: basically teaching the concepts that you learned in DSE. The PPT she provided are mainly the content from books. So, you don't need to buy book for understanding.  Also, in her course, you will watch quite a lots videos and funny clips. Most important is that, you would have break during the lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: Just following the PPT but sometimes will add deep sea question. She like to use IPRS to ask questions. However, her English pronunciation is not so well and you may have to listen carefully.
reviews.comment_grading: The mid term are not difficult but sometimes you would not really why you did it wrongly. She likes to ask the question tat carrying lots of marks. If you do it wrong in part a, then it has very large opportunities for you to get wrong answers in other parts.
reviews.comment_workload: not much homework. just two problem sets for one semester. She would suggest you to do the problems in books but actually they are not required to hand in. So, just having two problem sets to be hand in and they are graded.That's the most important point.

reviews.author: jenny98
reviews.comment_content:
she usually teach with the lecture notes.
The content is usually about margin, supply and demand, which is the things that we have learnt in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
she will have iprs quiz,
which make the class more interesting and can make the concept more clear in your mind.
There are good lecture notes with simple explaination,which worth studying:)
reviews.comment_grading: the tutor said that attendance is not counted in the grading,so it is good for those who want to skip lessons
reviews.comment_workload:
low workload
2 mid term exam
1 final exam
and some assignments

reviews.comment_teaching:
OK.
All the content can be found on powerpoint slides, so you don't have to attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is quite hardcore. Two MCQ midterms (only the better one counts) and a final - MCQ plus open questions. The mean on midterms is really high - they are doable for 100%
However the final was SUPER SUPER hard and really tricky. Wasn't prepared for that.

No quizzes, no attendence.
reviews.comment_workload: Moderate. The course is not hard, there are no quizes, you don't have to pay attention on every lesson.

reviews.comment_workload: Moderate. The course is not hard, there are no quizes, you don't have to pay attention on every lesson.

reviews.author: hihello
reviews.title: Very competitive
reviews.comment_content:
Content is not very challenging. Most things are already covered in Econ HKDSE. The new content introduced it easy to follow since HKDSE provides a good foundation.

Attendance was voluntary, though there were some days where "games" were played and attendance was counted.

Participation was encouraged by giving out cards.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof was interesting. He has a slight Mandarin accent, but not too strong.

He is quite a serious prof, so doesn't deviate from the syllabus, and doesn't make many jokes. You will learn if you try not to doze off.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad grade for the course since all students have studied half the content already for HKDSE. You may score high in exams but get a bad grade because everyone did so well.

Since this is one of the first courses you take when you enter university as a freshman, it may be discouraging and you will put pressure on yourself to do better in the future.
reviews.comment_workload:
- assignments (solce a problemset)
- midterm
- final

Light workload, very manageable.
There is no need to put in a lot of hours of extra study on top of classes and HW to understand the topic.

reviews.author: Um
reviews.comment_content:
-content is mainly similar to DSE Econ, except production possibility frontier (PPF)game theory
-No PRS questions
-No attendance will be taken during her class
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a really nice teacher with fluent English compared to most of the mainland professors. Reviewing exercises will always be provided before exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
-10% problem sets
-10%quizzes

-50% final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is extremely light compared to any other courses, there was only:
-one midterm exam: MC + short questions + essay type question
-one final exam: MC + short questions + essay type question
-two problem sets
-ten online quizzes

reviews.author: yoloswaglord
reviews.title: A very nice course teaching DSE level stuffs
reviews.comment_content: Concrete economics concepts, easy and understandable. Clear explanations with out syllabus stuffs for assistance and clarifications. Syllabus have some of the parts overlapping with DSE Economics syllabus, therefore even you skip some lectures, you can still understand the concepts and ideas. Lecture notes are easy-following.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice lecturer who make the class fun. Good interactions. Sometimes lecturer play some videos or playing a stimulation game with students to help them follow or understand the ideas. This may also help them to raise their learning motivation.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading system, getting B if you got mean. Exam is easy, yet mean is quite high, though reaching the mean is easy.
reviews.comment_workload: Only a weekly quiz, 2 assignments, 1 midterm, 1 final. Weekly quiz count on submission basis, meaning that it does not count your accuracy. Though taking it seriously can help you check your understanding about the previous lectures, that help a lot. Assignments are easy, but it counts accuracy. Nearly half of students get full mark. So need not to worry about that. Tutorial s provide useful materials that are practical problems, which may appears in exams.

reviews.author: unspecified
reviews.comment_content: Content not too difficult, especially if you have learnt previous topics before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally, I did not enjoy Ding Fei's lessons because of her slow teaching style. However, she did make repeated attempts for students to give her feedback so that she could change her teaching methods.
reviews.comment_grading: Not sure yet, will add once my grade is released.
reviews.comment_workload: Bi-weekly homework was easy (full marks if you just hand it in), midterm was medium, but final exam was the hardest exam I've ever done in my life. Topics that were not covered in-depth appeared in the exam.

reviews.comment_content: 基本econ野 但係教到price discrimination同game theory個到好似會教得比其他班同本書深入d

reviews.author: ihategpprojects
