Microeconomics, topics included demand supply, elasticity, externalities and personal benefit.
Be careful, the content and syllabus of Microeconomics taught by Hu, Wei wei and Lim, Woo Young is completely different. So don't waste your time to sit another professor's lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: The accent is not easy to understand, so you may get bored by her teaching. She follows the lecture notes and doesn't count attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair or poor.
Maybe I had missed one self-exercise before going to the final exam, so I got a bad grade. C+
reviews.comment_workload: Not many workload. There's 4 problem sets required. Participation and attendance marks won't be counted.

reviews.author: testname
reviews.comment_content: 相對於DSE level econ比較多數計，但係都係基礎數學
reviews.comment_teaching: 幾有心教書，上堂幾有趣，啲英文有啲accent，但係都容易聽得明白（相對於其他大陸professor）
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair, grades are given in proportion to your performance accordingly
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔想多，有幾份group homework，比起其他professor少（i.e. 其他professor會係individual homework），homework有時會上lecture有講過點做

reviews.author: Mauricelam
reviews.comment_content: Partly overlapped with DSE's economics, the only new idea might be the Game Theory. It would be quite easy for you to handle this course if you already understand the basic microeconomics knowledge well during your secondary studies.
reviews.comment_teaching: His funny accent and dynamic presentation skill will always grab your attention, he is also good at explaining complex ideas with simple but representative examples, one of the most popular lecturer.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one midterm and one final throughout the semester, homework is given once per three weeks but  teamwork is allowed, very light workload.

reviews.author: ykal
reviews.comment_content:
high school stuff such as demand and supply, marginal cost, efficiency etc.
only new thing are game theory, indifference curve and PPF.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is clear but boring, especially in a LT with bad air circulation. Many topics are learnt in secondary school so it is not that important to pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: very good, but the curve is high as the exam content is not very hard. The game theory part is similar with practice questions.
reviews.comment_workload: only a few assignment throughout the whole semester. with midterm and final.

reviews.author: Rayne
reviews.title: A dedicated professor that is engaging
reviews.comment_content: One of the best professors I had for the whole year of study in terms of teaching, grading and workload
reviews.comment_teaching: Very engaging in terms of presentation styles that would help keep you awake for most of the class
reviews.comment_grading: Quite fair considering as long as you get around 1 sd above the mean for both the midterm and final then it's very likely for you to be in the A range
reviews.comment_workload:
A problem set every two or three weeks
No quizzes or projects or presentation
Other than that no other regular workload

reviews.author: Chillinliba
reviews.title: Skip every lesson and easy A+
reviews.comment_content: Non-cumulative final area. Just 5 chapters in mid-term and 5 chapters in final. Very few content was included compared to other professor's.
reviews.comment_teaching: Powerpoint reader. Recommend to skip if you want to have a better use of time or just sleep for longer hours. I skip every lessons except the first two. The TA teaches better than the professor. Can attend to some tutorial lessons if necessary. Or just read the materials uploaded to Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading. As long as you have normal IQ, A- is just a piece of cake to you. What a disgrace if you can't even get a B+.

I got full mark in assignment, 97/100 in mid-term and 91/100 in final. Easy A+. Can't do it without Youtube University.
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly Assignment; sometimes bi-weekly
7 in total
Just remember to submit it then you will get full mark.
Some answers can be found on the internet.
My friend just randomly guess the mc and left half the long questions for blank but still got full mark every time.
Some concepts are not well-explained in the ppt so you need to search it online for further understanding.

reviews.author: WONG Yat Kit
reviews.comment_content: If you are an A-Level student and you are not able to transfer this course, then congratulations!!!!!! This  course  is almost the same as the topic you learned in A-level microeconomics. Only covers several new topics. These topics are really easy and you can learn them easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is patient and full of passion. You can ask her questions through Whatsapp. Sometimes she will give you a reply at the weekend!! However, it is true that her lectures are relatively boring. It is easy for students to fall asleep. However, she sometimes talks about some unrelated topics on lectures. I do not feel good about this point.
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance  will be counted.
Scheme 1: 25% HW+25% midterm +50% Final
Scheme 2: 25% HW+75% Final
They will choose the scheme with higher scores for students automatically.
Meanwhile, when you do homework, just try your best. She will give you full credits when you did most of the questions correctly.
You do not need to make sure all of the questions are correct. She will choose five highest HWs to grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very small. Roughly one homework per two weeks.
No quiz and presentation. One midterm and one final.

reviews.author: Hiha
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content: Microeconomics
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂要drop notes,畫圖,ppt上面唔會有晒上堂講ge野，不過prof.之後都會upload返上堂ge ppt(有notes ge)
進度唔會太慢太快，最後仲有一堂revision,不過同final無咩關係
會問學生意見，因為midterm比較難，所以final簡單d，同sample paper ge題型差唔多
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 唔難，大部分MC，會有1-2條Short q and 畫圖。Assignment唔難拎滿分，佢唔會睇你d答案，mc 係自動對，只要mc差唔多啱晒（錯1,2題）就會計你滿分
走左幾堂，上堂無咩認真聽書，midterm低過mean少少，final高mean少少
Overall grading: B  高過我預期
reviews.comment_workload:
7份Assignment，計最高個5份
Midterm and final

reviews.author: dastriaghtAkid
reviews.comment_content: Very similar to DSE economics just adding on a litttle bit new stuffs like game theory.
reviews.comment_teaching: Suppppppppppper good teaching. Her teaching is very detailed and on-point.Very easy to understand. Definitely reg her!
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean is high as the content is quite easy, bear in mind of that. You have to score very high in order to secure an A range.
You can also raise up your hand to answer questions in order to gain extra credits!!
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy workload, you can get full mark if you finish all the homework. No attendance.

reviews.author: Crrystal
reviews.title: Very easy
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy if u hv got over level 5 in hkdse. The PowerPoints and tutorial notes are extremely clear. Understanding is much more important than reciting. No need to recite every word on the notes. A little calculation is needed.
reviews.comment_teaching: I skipped 70% of the lectures and attended all Tutorials but I still got a good grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Reasonable
Mid term1: 93
Mid term2: 98
Final: 97
Did all assignments and earned 2 extra credits.
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Light. Quizzes and problem sets are credit by submission. They said they will check randomly to see if irrelevant files are uploaded.

reviews.author: fuwafuwa
reviews.title: Good professor & TA
reviews.comment_content:
I think the coverage of the content is alright for a UST course. Although I learnt DSE ECON, most of the content is new building on our previous knowledge

Topics covered:

What is economics?
The economic problem
Demand and supply
Elasticity
Efficiency ad Equity
Government Actions in Markets
Global Markets in Actions
Consumers' behavior
Output and costs
Perfect competition
Monopoly
Oligopoly
reviews.comment_teaching:
She teaches us in an interactive way, often write summary, draw diagrams and even conduct some "experiments" for us to understand some economic concepts.

But I think her teaching pace is really fast. Her speaking speed is fast and she always say sth that is not found in the PPT, so I could never copy all the extra things she said in the lecture. I always had to watch the recording after each lecture, which takes muchhh time. This is a really big struggle.

On the other hand, the TA is really great, Peter is a really friendly TA. I had asked him questions for quite a few times.

Tips!! The tutorials are harder than the lecture content, but from what I rmb, the exams are completely not related to tutorial content. So, I think in a sense you can skip the tutorial
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading of this course is quite good.

A tip for the exams in this course is that they really examine your understanding on the concepts, so dont put much emphasis on reciting the PPT. Make sure you can understand the concepts clearly and apply them on different scenario.

There are two schemes for the grading, you can refer to other's reviews.

You can also earn extra credit by answering questions/ joining her "experiments" I strongly suggest you guys to earn the extra credit, cuz most ppl in this course are quite good at econ that the mean of all the exams was quite high!
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light. There are 5 quizzes and 3 problem sets as assignments. As long as you submit those quizzes and problem sets, you get the marks. Although the mark is counted on submission basis, I strongly suggest you guys to do the assignments seriously,

** the mid-term and especially the final exam questions are quite similar to those in the problem set and the quizzes **

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: A good course that hard work pays off
reviews.comment_content:
Just some basic stuff from HKDSE and some new things. If you are confident in HKDSE economics, you don't need to worry.

Topics covered:

What is economics?
The economic problem
Demand and supply
Elasticity
Efficiency ad Equity
Government Actions in Markets
Global Markets in Actions
Consumers' behavior
Output and costs
Perfect competition
Monopoly
Oligopoly

Most of the contents require you to understand them instead of reciting them. This may sound good to some people. Moreover, usually at the end of each chapter, there will be a huge part of things that are not included in the exam. So the contents to be tested are less than the actual syllabus.

This is a good course for those who like learning because it solidifies your knowledge of HKDSE economics and allows you to learn something new.   

Warning: There are many graphs in this course so be prepared for that xd
reviews.comment_teaching: Ms. Zhang is a good instructor. She provides detailed explanations of the course material as well as some tables for summarizations.  There are also some class interactions and 'Economic experiments', which adds some fun to the classroom.
reviews.comment_grading:
The overall grading of this course is not bad. If you understand all the contents covered in lessons and try to do some exercise given by the tutor, you will be fine. There are 5 quizzes, 2 midterms, and 1 final.

My grade:
Quiz 1: 19/20 (Mean: 17)
Quiz 2: 19/20 (Mean:16.1)
Quiz 3: 20/20 (Mean:17.5)
Quiz 4: 20/20 (Mean:16.4)
Quiz 5: 17/20  (Mean:16.1)
Midterm 1: 86/100 (Mean:79.8)
Midterm 2: 97/100 (Mean:89)
Final exam: 91.5/100 (Mean:73.7)

Overall grade: A

Note: You can earn extra credits by answering questions during lessons. However, I did not do any of that.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload in this course is not light. Apart from 5 quizzes, 2 midterms, and 1 final exam, there are 3 problem sets as well. Each problem set has many questions. It took me around 2 to 3 hours to finish each of them.  There are also 3 self practices, but they do not need to be submitted, which can be a good way to try some questions.

reviews.author: Anth
reviews.comment_content:
Simple and concise lecture notes but mostly are from textbooks. He applied some real-life examples for class discussion and enhance our comprehension but only in certain topics like demand and supply or oligopoly.
The most struggling component is the exam content as he explained numerous topics and theories but he only included the calculation part into the exam, therefore it could be confusing to prepare for the exam
reviews.comment_teaching: He tried to answer student's questions on and off class which shows an enthusiasm in teaching. Even thought he might not explain in details or reply our questions directly, he treated most of the students quite gentle. He respond to our email very quickly and elaborate with most of the solutions we require, therefore he is one of the most passionate and kind professor.
reviews.comment_grading: Since the policy has changed to absolute grading, he marking is somehow strict which led to a lower possibility of A range. Most of the score was released despite the peer review, therefore it's sort of transparent for grade review
reviews.comment_workload: One problem set per 2 weeks which is quite light in terms of workload as it's a group assignment.

reviews.author: lt
reviews.title: If you are a self-learner, please take li xuan.
reviews.comment_content:
DSE content but a much more in depth version.
Chapter 1: What is Economics?
Chapter 2: The Economic Problem
Chapter 3: Demand and Supply
Chapter 4: Elasticity
Chapter 5: Efficiency and Equity
Chapter 6: Government Actions in Markets
Chapter 7: Global Markets in Action
Chapter 9: Possibilities, Preferences, and Choice
Chapter 11: Output and Costs
Chapter 12: Perfect Competition
Chapter 13: Monopoly & Price Discrimination
Chapter 15: Oligopoly & Basic Game Theory
Chapter 16: Public Choices and Public Goods
Chapter 17: Externalities
reviews.comment_teaching:
NEVER expect you can learn anything from her lecture. Please take her course if you don't mind SELF-LEARNING.  She simply used the ppt that most likely is provided from publisher with a little bit edit to finish all her teaching. The ppt she provided is just the another version of the textbook, with the same wordings and graph. Not to mention her teaching materials, she speaks really fast with plain tone and weird pronunciation. You would find
hard not to fall asleep when you are listening to her intently. In a nutshell, all the learning depends on YOURSELF.
reviews.comment_grading: The mid term and final are incredibly difficult that the mean is extremely low. All the homework will be given full mark no matter how much effort you spend on it. It is the EXAM that determine your grade. Overall, the grading is fair in spite of the low mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 homework
1 midterm
1 final
Quite heavy workload when compared with other professor. All the homework are LONG QUESTIONS as well as most of the part of mid-term and final. The content she taught is MUCH MORE HARDER than other professor that would take you more time for this course.

reviews.author: Rigbones
reviews.title: Absolute shit professor. Shit teaching. Covers much more content in exam than other professors.
reviews.comment_content:
DSE economics content, but much more in depth, with many new concepts in the second half of term.  Good at DSE econ does not guarantee good at this course at all.  This shit professor also covers much more chapters in the final exam than other professors.

Chapter 1: What is Economics?
Chapter 2: The Economic Problem
Chapter 3: Demand and Supply
Chapter 4: Elasticity
Chapter 5: Efficiency and Equity
Chapter 6: Government Actions in Markets
Chapter 7: Global Markets in Action
Chapter 9: Possibilities, Preferences, and Choice
Chapter 11: Output and Costs
Chapter 12: Perfect Competition
Chapter 13: Monopoly & Price Discrimination
Chapter 15: Oligopoly & Basic Game Theory
Chapter 16: Public Choices and Public Goods
Chapter 17: Externalities
reviews.comment_teaching:
Worst economics professor ever.  Chalk-and-talk professor.  Really poor out-of-focus teaching.  Does not have a good grasp on what students know and don't know, and as a result sometimes talks about stuff nobody understands (for example complicated math), and also spends too much time talking about simple concepts.  

Does not have any grasp at all on what students find hard.  No polling questions to test students understanding.  No in-class self-quizzes or asking students questions, so there is absolutely no class participation from the students side.  

Classes involve reading powerpoints only, but she still manages to make it hard to follow.  She even makes simple concepts very challenging to understand, and so you can imagine how it is when she talks about hard concepts.  For example, she never explained the difference between "quantity demanded" and "demand".  If you haven't taken Econ before, how the hell are you supposed to follow.

I attended lectures until after the midterm and I just couldn't take it anymore.  I think I have good tolerance for bad, boring teaching but this is just too much.  I stopped attending her classes and with the help of my friend attended Fei Ding's classes instead.  Fei Ding's teaching was heaven, and her classes were actually inspiring and it really gets your brain juice excited.  Fuck Xuan Li.

Do the best you can to swap Xuan Li for another professor.  If you can't, find someone who attends Fei Ding's lectures and get the zoom code from them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 20%
Remaining 80%

Remaining 80% has 2 grading schemes,
Scheme 1 is 35% midterm, 45% finals;
Scheme 2 is 22.5% midterm, 57.5% finals.

Midterms and finals are both extremely challenging.  MC and long questions.  Requires complete grasp of basic knowledge and ability to use that knowledge to infer what would happen in an out-of-syllabus question.  For example,  Monopoly (many buyers, only 1 seller) is in the syllabus, and the exam required us to use that knowledge to solve a problem involving Monopsony (Only 1 buyer, many sellers).

My grades:
Homework 25/25, mean 25/25 (yes everybody got full marks)
Midterm 55/74, mean 42.9, sd 8.6
Finals 74/105, mean 50.9, sd 12.8
Letter grade A.

Tips for getting A:
I did poorly in DSE economics, but by attending Fei Ding's lectures, I managed to pull off an A.  Reading the textbook and completing textbook exercises is not really helpful.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload.  5 problem sets, can groupwork.  If you do it alone it will take 2 nights to complete each problem set, so it's not that bad.

reviews.author: AndyChan
reviews.title: ECON2123
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introductions to Macroeconomics
2. The short run closed Economy
3. The short run open economy
4. The medium run (AS-AD Model)


focuses on how production and output are calculated and the underlying theory of how the openness of country effects these indicators of a country. This is a course that is more content heavy and slightly complicated than micro - quote by Fei Ding
reviews.comment_teaching: Focused on theories of each model and takes time to explain why each theory is important in relation to one another. Incorporates real-life examples from time to time and opens discussions making students think critically about real-life problems; applying what we have learnt to the outside world. Prof Ding Fei herself does not like accounting and keeps that part of Econ brief and rather focuses on the economy and graphical concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Problem sets: 8%
Quizzes (best 2 of 3): 32%
Mini project (optional): 10%
Final Exam: 50 or 60%

very dependent on your performance in the final exam

There is a mini project that is optional for students in groups of 3-4 to present to the class. You can choose on a macroeconomic topic to present to a class and apply theories you have learnt in class to these examples. Research and preparation of the presentation are required. However, the best part of this presentation is that it is marked based on completion and not on how well it is done. It is definitely better to choose to do this mini-project then to let that 10% of your grade go to the final project.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is very low. The problem sets are only marked by completion and effort, not on the accuracy of your answers. The most stressful part must be studying for quizzes and exams.

The tutorials are also very casual as the TA will teach you how to work on the problem sets so even if you don't know how to do the questions given in the problem set, you can see how to TA tackles these questions. Therefore, the tutorial is supposed to further decrease the workload you have for this course.

reviews.author: Charmie
reviews.comment_content:
由淺入深，開頭個幾課中學課程都有涵蓋，不過會有新concept補充同埋間唔中都會有D地方同中學既教法唔同。lecture powerpoint有D地方解釋得唔夠完整。
Ch0. Introduction
Ch1. Thinking like economists
Ch2. Specialization and Gain from Trade
Ch3. Demand and Supply
Ch4. Elasticity
Ch5. Efficiency and Equity
Ch6. Government meets Market
Ch8. Utility and Demand
Ch9. Possibilities, Preferences and Choices
Ch10. Organizing Production
Ch11. Output and Costs
Ch12. Perfect Competition
Ch13, Monopoly
Ch15. Strategic Interaction and Oligopoly
Ch17. Externalities
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. 就幾有耐性。肯花時間答問題。上堂間唔中做下prs，不過唔計分，又唔take attendance，所以唔上堂都冇人理你。
唔會飛書教，重要既地方會講多D，所以都唔錯。
reviews.comment_grading:
第一堂已經講明會盡比a range 同b range，所以應該幾好Grade。不過始終都要落力D讀，呢個course 唔算好易，最緊要concept清。
兩種grading schemes:
1) 5% problem sets
    25% mid-term1
    25% mid-term2
    45% final exam
2) 5% problem sets
    35% the best of the two mid-terms
    60% final exam
用邊種grading scheme視乎你邊種既總分會高D。你最多可以走一次midterm，咁就自動變scheme 2。problem sets 總共8個，每個10至20條不等，你上canvas交白紙都冇人理，有交有分。
reviews.comment_workload:
平時可以話冇workload。做下佢比既問題，溫下書，final 同 mid term 前做做佢比既sample paper 就ok.
Final 一定要做多d準備，基本上你明晒全部concept 同計算部分已經足夠

reviews.author: YCL2018
reviews.title: Different from IB Economics HL
reviews.comment_content:
Overall, the content in the beginning seems quite similar to IB Economics HL. However, as you move on passing midterms, the key content (that will be tested in the finals) will be significantly different from the IB syllabus such as indifference curve, groves-clarke mechanism, etc.

It may be fine to skip class in the beginning of the semester is you are confident with your knowledge from IB but you may be risking some key contents that IB never touched on and that will be hard to self-study.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is Professor Neary's first year teaching this course, so in view of that, it was quite good. While he may stutter a bit during lectures, he delivers the content quite well and is always willing to listen to students feedback and answer their questions.

He also uses interactive games in class to highlight certain material especially during the game theory sections of the syllabus.
reviews.comment_grading:
Professor Neary is considerably lenient in his grading and assessments. The homework (10% of final grade) is often the hardest and if you understand the homework, you will more than likely score well in the finals and mid-terms.

In terms of level of difficulty, it goes by this:
Lecture content<Mid-terms/Finals<Homework

Understanding the homework will definitely help in the exams and the Professor and TA often goes through the homework to ensure students' understanding.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a bit heavier not in terms of quantity but level of difficulty. The homework often includes content that has not been touched in class yet so it will take time to further research about it. Nonetheless, understanding the homework will really help in your general understanding of economics and the course.

reviews.author: Sophia.m
reviews.title: Good grade if you hv nice logic
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is covered in the DSE syllabus, but some concepts that are taught in DSE are revealed to be wrong, so better pay attention to the lesson and figure out the whole thing. Well, reciting does not help much in your final and mid-term, you have to make sure you understand the concepts. Dun skip the lesson when It comes to games theory, otherwise u won't be able to understand it. Also, going thru the questions behind each chapter is not that useful when the style is totally different.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a funny person and a nice man with much passion. Pls pay attention to his lesson, dun be ate otherwise he will find u after the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean of mid-term is quite low, like 99.6/200 and sd is about 30. I got one hundred sth in mid term and the mean of final is more or less the same but the sd is like 40 sth I got 1.5 sd higher than the sd while most of my hw is below mean. I got A- finally. Thus, final is super important.
reviews.comment_workload: Kind of light, only 3 assignments and you can finish it with our friends. Pls pay attention to your careless mistakes!! Otherwise, likely to be below mean.

reviews.author: Eason_wsk
reviews.comment_content: easy stuff. most content is covered in HKDSE and concept is not difficult. this course is relatively easier than other courses
reviews.comment_teaching: quite useless. reading notes at home by urself is enough for this course.
reviews.comment_grading: very good. my mid term abd final exam is roughly above sd and i got an overall grade A for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is very light. u just have to hand in 2 problem sets and do 10 online quiz (10 mc quetions) on canvas for 20% of the course. there is 2 mid term but u can simply ust 1 mid term and ur final exam for grade calculation .

reviews.author: USTSPACEMAN
reviews.title: ECON2113
reviews.comment_content: Mostly basic stuffs learnt in DSE like Demand Supply, elasticity etc. New stuffs such as indifference curve, marginal utility are also included. Easy to handle and you don't need much time to understand the whole syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Haven't attended any lessons since Week2. I am not sure about it but i heard that she was okay.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. Final above mean 1 SD got an A for it.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 midterms, 1 final. 10 MC quizzes in canvas (based on submission) so you can make a wild guess for all questions, 2 homework sets (quite long). Not big deal.

reviews.author: Steve/inhoe
reviews.title: ECON 2113
reviews.comment_content: Content are basic micro stuff that we once learnt. Micro and some basic econ concepts that can be easily found anywhere on the internet. Just make sure you check the class ppt which helps alot
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite good, very interactive and efficient
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite nice but it can be hard if you skip classes and dont put your time on it. nothing can be done if you dont try at all. The content is easy so try to study and revise you will be fine to get a decent grade without too much hustle
reviews.comment_workload: HW quite alot but other than that pretty light

reviews.author: Jesslyn
reviews.comment_content: It's pretty much repeating what you've learned in highschool, especially for a level students. kinda easy to cope and she uses real life examples for her lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: she's pretty nice but she tend to go quick, it's not much of a problem since i've learned them in highschool. But she accomodates lots of questions after class or you can even look for her in her office and she's willing to help
reviews.comment_grading: Quizzes are graded based on handing it in on time (no matter if you do them badly). 2 exams, she chooses the better one to be calculated into your tga.
reviews.comment_workload: not sure yet since I havent gotten any work.

reviews.author: 經濟之鬼
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: What is Economics?
Chapter 2: The Economic Problem
Chapter 3: Demand and Supply
Chapter 4: Elasticity
Chapter 5: Efficiency and Equity
Chapter 6: Government Actions in Markets
Chapter 7: Global Markets in Action
Chapter 9: Possibilities, Preferences, and Choice
Chapter 11: Output and Costs
Chapter 12: Perfect Competition
Chapter 13: Monopoly & Price Discrimination
Chapter 15: Oligopoly & Basic Game Theory
Chapter 16: Public Choices and Public Goods
Chapter 17: Externalities

Basically extensions from DSE Economics, but it would be really time-consuming to understand the concepts if you are not that interested.  Hence, you may not be able to get a good grade from this course if your maths is not that good.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Xuan really tried hard in teaching and she is willing to give immediate responses through emails when we encounter problems.  However, it would be better if the difficult concepts can be presented in a clearer manner.

Peter (TA) is also very friendly and would offer a helping hand when we encounter problems as well
reviews.comment_grading:
5 Homework Sets, Mid-term and Final

Homework Sets (20%)
Basically guaranteed if you really put effort in completing the homework sets with your group members.  

Mid-Term + Exam (80%)
Grade Scheme 1: 35% Mid-Term + 45% Final
Grade Scheme 2: 22.5% Mid-Term + 57.5% Final

Scheme 2 probably appeared because the mid-term result is so shit..... (But the final is even lower than mid-term in terms of percentage)

Mid-Term and Finals are crazy shit hard, especially the LQs but Xuan is really lenient on grading, you can get a good grade already if you are over mean.

Mid-Term: ~0.5 s.d. over mean
Final: > 3 s.d. over mean
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
5 Homework Sets (4 with 10 questions, 1 with 6 questions)
It may not seem that many but there are many subparts in each question, the critical thinking process in resolving the question is also complicated.  In the end, you may found your answer completely different with the model answers.

reviews.author: Jasonkcy
reviews.title: Good professor
reviews.comment_content:
About half of the content overlaps with the DSE syllabus, so the concepts are quite straight forward.
-What is Economics?
-The Economic Problems
-Demand and Supply
-Elasticity
-Efficiency and Equity
-Government Actions in Markets
-Global Markets in Action
-Possibilities, Preferences, and Choices
-Output and Costs
-Perfect Competition
-Monopoly and price discriminations
-Oligopoly and basic game theory
-Public choices and goods
-Externalities
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor always answers students' questions patiently. And the lecture slides are also very clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework  assignments 20%
Exams: midterm (2 hours)+ final exam (3 hours) 80%
The total exam grade will be determined by the highest of the following two: a)  35% midterm+45% final b)  22.5% midterm+57.5% final

Both mid term and final consist of MCs and long q and the long questions are really hard (especially final). They are much harder than the problems in tutorial, sample paper and problem sets. The mean was quite low in long q both mid term and final. I think most of us relied on the MCs to get more marks.

Overall, really good grade. Both Mid term and Final only above mean for 0.8-0.9SD, but gets an A at last.
reviews.comment_workload: 5 problem sets, 3-4 people in a group in the whole semester. The problem sets are a little bit hard cause I and my groupmates often spend much time discussing the questions but still have a wrong answer. However, it seems that it only counts if you have submitted it.

reviews.author: Dicky123
reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment_content: Pretty amazing contents with great explanation on the economic concepts
reviews.comment_teaching: Eager to answer to questions in class, emails and during in-class breaks. Pretty chill atmosphere
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty easy to get good grades, homework, mid term, final exam

Homework marks are pretty good, almost everyone can have full marks. It is mostly based on the input of effort, but not merely on the accuracy of the answers.

For exams, you have MC, long questions like drawing graphs and data based questions as well which you need to answer accordingly to the data provided

No attendance needed for tutorial and lecture classes

No essay, no project, no group work and no presentation
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty chill, 1 week is given  to do the homework normally

reviews.author: Hi_everyone
reviews.title: Normal teaching but good grade
reviews.comment_content: A more in-depth version of the DSE syllabus, tons of new concepts in the second part of the course (after the mid-term).
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say the teaching is fair. Some concepts are skipped in the lessons but it is fine, as the prerequisite of this course is DSE economics. At least professor will try her best to explain some abstract concepts (although sometimes she failed to explain clearly).

But... to be honest, it is impossible the explain all abstract concepts in economics by words. Students should get the concepts with their own efforts instead.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignment: 20 %
Mid term exam: 35%
final exam: 45 %
OR
Homework assignment: 20 %
Mid term exam: 22.5%
final exam:57.5  %
(higher of the above 2)

Actually both exams are challenging, as a result the mean and median score is low. So whether the exam paper is difficult or not does not really matter.

My grade:

homework: 25/25

Mid-term:
MC 17/18
Long Q 48/56
Overall 65/74, mean 42.9, sd 8.6

Final exam:
MC 25/27
Long Q 64/78
Overall 89/105, mean 50.9, sd 12.8

Letter grade: A+, the grading is really good.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fine.

5 problem sets, each has about 10 questions.

reviews.author: vinyobject
reviews.comment_content:
Ch.1 What is Economics
Ch.2 The Economic Problem
Ch.3 Supply and Demand
Ch.4 Elasticity
Ch.5 Efficiency and Equity
Ch.6 Government Actions in Markets
Ch.7 Global Markets in Actions
Ch.8-9 Possibilities, Preferences, and Choices
Ch.11 Output and Costs
Ch.12 Perfect Competition
Ch.13 Monopoly
Ch.15 Oligopoly
Ch.16 Public Goods
Ch.17 Externalities

Topics taught before first mid-term are all covered in the DSE syllabus.
Though topics after first mid-term exam are mostly new things, they are not too difficult.

Tutorials give quick reviews of things taught in lecture with some example questions.
TEACHING
Professor is very patient. She always stayed behind to answer students' questions.

The lecture ppts are very detailed and clear. Even if you missed any lecture, you can still catch up simply by reading the ppts. Textbook is optional since the lecture ppts are very good.
GRADING
Assessment contains the following:

1) Problem sets (10%)
There are 2 problem sets in total. Answer to the most of the questions can be found on the Internet.

2) Online Quizzes (10%)
10 Quizzes in total. 10 questions each. They are credited by submission. As long as you submit all the quizzes before deadline, no matter how much score you got, you'll still get a full mark for this category.

3) Mid-term Exams (20%+20% OR 30%)
2 Mid-term exams in total. Topics covered in each exam were very few. Both are quite easy.
- 35 MCQ (70%), 2 LQ (30%)
- 1st Mid-term: Mean 85.3, S.D. 8.6
- 2nd Mid-Term: Mean 80.7 S.D. 9.4

4) Final Exam (40% OR 50%)
Difficulty is easier than DSE Econ.
- Mean: 83.8 S.D.: 11.95

~93-95% A-
~95-98% A
~98-100% A+
reviews.comment_teaching: fair
reviews.comment_grading: fair
reviews.comment_workload: fair

reviews.author: Sofy Twilight
reviews.title: Grading not transparent, relatively easy content.
reviews.comment_content:
Ordinary Microeconomics Content, literally following the book Microeconomics by Parkin

You may follow the attachment for the syllabus of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Actually, his accent is quite ok. Or I would like to conclude in this way, the young mainland business profs with US/UK background have a good accent in English which is easily understandable for the whole class. So don't worry about this issue.

On the other hand, for his powerpoint, I would say some places are not that organized, and for this, you would probably like to check the reference book.

His teaching is quite clear and can explain those concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is unfair to comment it because his grading is not transparent at all.
The course consists of...

5 Problem sets 20% (You can work in a group at max. 4 people)
Midterm 30%
Final 50%

We only know our problem sets and midterm marks. While no details of midterm and final mark distribution is given. So, I can't provide any useful reference for you.

The midterm and final have similar format and difficulty as the homework. And you can do the pastpaper on petergao as reference, that definitely helps you.

Mine:
Problem sets 20/20
Midterm 40/40
Final idk/I forget (But I am quite confident I got at least 95% of marks)
Grade A+

FYI I got 5* in DSE Economics and doing UROP project on Economics currently.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light. The problem sets consist not many problems, and you can do it with your friends!
